alert.note: Alert for Northern Trinity (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued September 01 at 8:51AM PDT until September 01 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE RIVER COMPLEX BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the River Complex burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following area, Northern Trinity. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the River Complex burn scar near an inch per hour is possible during the period of the watch. The threat for debris flows due to heavy rainfall will be highest across the Coffee Creek drainage basine. Residents should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding across wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
